jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

FAD0157A1C5E40058892909384DFC52B.description:
Compare the arguments of competing
public interest groups on constitutional
rights.

B569CCD33A694C0DA498E5B6CE3C2DFF.description:
Analyze conflicts over the rights and
freedom of competing individuals or
groups.

980848DAA2984EEF98D4CDD005739103.description:
Give examples of events where people
have had to fight to win their equality
and/or religious freedom.

661301ABD7E94ED88076D26A266627A8.description:
Understand the development of the United States political ideas and traditions. Understand the development of religious/spiritual aspects of the United States political ideas and traditions. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4       Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7        Value the significance and impact to the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5         Internalize Catholic virtues and values from the study of human history to better evaluate one’s own behaviors, the trends of contemporary
society, and prevalent social pressures and norms. CSDS4

CCC16EA1F9744A1AAD9ABA037EA903CA.description:
Identify U.S. foreign policy that
supports Catholic Church teaching
(e.g., justice, stewardship, human
dignity).

95FE04C0C53E401593519FC393FD2938.description:
Research an historical treaty the United
States has signed with another nation or
international organization.

391A813F68774AFF85F340D7EF67DB2C.description:
Describe the leadership role of the
United States in international
organizations (e.g., the United Nations,
NATO, IMF).

E82FAB53CFD74B2E8FAB94A422CF0F12.description:
Identify a political tradition or custom
that had its origin in another country
(e.g., representative government).

5BCD1A89F6F4498E931BCB4E9188FBDB.description:
Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and international issues. Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and Catholic Church issues. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7        Explain what is positive in the world, what needs to be changed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4       Explore how the moral qualities of the citizenry naturally give rise to the nature of the government and influence societal outcomes and
destinies. CSIS13 (7&8)         Identify the dangers of relativism present in the notion that one culture cannot critique another, that truth is culturally created; or that truth is
not to be shared and celebrated wherever found. CSIS27 (7&8)

F97FC0BCF89B402AA77436F7A649C22D.description:
Explain why Jesus calls us to a life of
service and to use our talents to serve
others.

46B5B3A4DE9D4C96983E9CC96CECC51E.description:
Describe an event or period in history
in which individual Catholics or
Catholic interest groups influenced
public policy.

989811C8E0A44F378625BA8BEF5E8E73.description:
Describe an historical event or period
in which political parties influenced
public policy.

0BC4F3862EEF4F4AA97503733170F0B9.description:
Explain how political parties and
interest groups affect legislation.

4B20F98F70DC4D2F9F1F2FA504D145D8.description:
Analyze ways in which the media is
used by political parties and interest
groups to influence public opinion.

9C13C27A79724E1C846565759A2423DF.description:
Analyze actions taken by governments
to improve the lives of people.

0FD5986CD38E4F6EAD4B5A695EB1827C.description:
Summarize an individual's or group's
motivation for participating in the
shaping of public policy.

EA6542961A1C428E8F139BF893F85548.description:
Understand the roles and influences of individuals and interest groups in the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the roles and influences of individual Catholics and Catholic interest groups. Identify the differences among the values of various political systems and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7       Recognize how the central themes within the stories of important Catholic figures and saints repeat over time. CSIS6       Explore how the moral qualities of the citizenry naturally give rise to the nature of the government and influence societal outcomes and
destinies. CSIS13 (7&8)        Discuss thoughts and deeds of great men and women of the past. CSIS15

C8E7E0A6DBB4403ABDD573A7604E7337.description:
Discuss the moral responsibilities of
citizens in choosing leaders that
support the teachings of the Church.

F494F2CD55AB423FAC5182D7492772C4.description:
Analyze historical events involving the
extension or denial of political and
electoral rights of various citizens or
groups of people.

A214456B34384CCB98460F72E9E87C45.description:
Explain how people are elected to all
levels of our government.

25F829059C38413C85516845122F1618.description:
Explain the role of a citizen in choosing
leaders.

BACC7556ADBA4B0D8D944D0949F49186.description:
Create a list of ideas that would
encourage more civic responsibility
among people.

5C8BFE9C2EAC472FB4FAE3A80969D36E.description:
Understand election processes and responsibilities of citizens. Understand the election process and special responsibilities of Catholic citizens. Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those that will come after us. CSDS2          Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7          Value one’s own role and dignity as man in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5          Compare the actions of peoples according to their historical and cultural norms to current Catholic moral norms and virtues. CSIS11 (7&8)

B92330E4D68342C4B0C0E4EF7CB266F8.description:
Plan and/or participate in service
projects that help the community.

06979A9AA5B94E0D8684BAD2E261BF50.description:
Compare and contrast the structure
and function of our political systems
with the Catholic Church.

348A4D3C2CA743E4B36A1290C663C932.description:
Explain the distributed and shared
powers of the local, state, and federal
government.

0A24634F3CDF47499BF58C03B6097B00.description:
List the top officials in Illinois State
government.

2EBD1DA8B0274A2A826A15BBB0F43996.description:
Explain the reasons for having the
system of checks and balances as part
of the organization of the federal
government.

1B869369129A4E918907A863B1BDD3B0.description:
Describe the characteristics of a two house
legislature.

C6B1413C936E4D12B82E9A46582237E0.description: Understand the structures and functions of the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the relationship of Church structure and functions to the structures and functions of the political systems of the United States and other nations. Describe how we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3     Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan. CSIS8       Discuss how Church structure and function can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12       Identify what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4       Compare the actions of peoples according to their historical and cultural norms to current Catholic moral norms and virtues. CSIS11 (7&8)

5B79D1C34DE64E778BEEED5D8A5D0A21.description:
Identify and describe elements of
political systems that support or
contradict principles of the Catholic
Church.

DF8429AB81494EA09DD28288BFE5F9D0.description:
Compare the political office process to
the way Church leaders are appointed.

E44C2BD480F341F987320516DF1E6A19.description:
Distinguish between the characteristics
of a limited and unlimited government.

42E3C9EC8604476EA5DB94C62DB9D726.description:
Name the courts and judicial officials
for local, state, and federal
governments.

F4F11C9FD2664BD29FB808851E311D72.description:
Summarize the main points in
constitutional documents.

2D387342849140E0A5B2760F123178AB.description:
Explain the importance of having a
written constitution for a government.

63AB2EBF3CBB4032B92FBD2A1A52C437.description:
Define the concept of "consent of the
governed."

5639FCC989674ADB8B50E981EA204CF0.description:
Understand and explain basic principles of the United States government. Understand the relationship of basic principles for the U.S. Government and the Catholic Church Government. Understand what God does for humanity. CSIS3     Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan CSIS8        Examine how one’s own life and life-choices creates a personal history with eternal consequences. CSIS3 (7 &8)       Demonstrate the ways mankind and societies change and/or persist over time to better understand the human condition. CSIS8
(7&8)

A8E07E59748449E393C15F04D0C55F63.description: Understand political systems, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand the relationship of the Church and its systems to political systems of the United States.
